p.s: The newspaper article Language learning in the UK: 'can't, won't, don't', written by John Worne and published in The Telegraph on 27th January 2015, describes the phenomenon of a decreasing amount of students, learning a foreign language in the UK, which is interconnected with the national view on foreign languages.
Worne starts his article with an outline of the problem: Fewerfewer students learn foreign languages and the count of students taking exams in these subjects decreased.
Also the idea of substituting these skills with machines or thinking that English is widespread enough, to avoid learning other languages, is for Worne no solution.
So for global economy, trade or diplomacy, speaking foreign languages is a required skill.
Cause of the lack of foreign speakers, some companies started outsourcing these jobs.
A possible way to solve this problem may be the concept of studying a language alongside another subject.

Lastly, Worne expoenes his main solution and appeals to all parents: Parentsparents have to think about teaching their children cultural awareness, so that they think more about international experiences.
